intro: Launaea lanifera, commonly known as the silky dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant features a hairy, cylindrical stem covered with soft, silky hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered with fine, white茸毛, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Launaea lanifera produces small yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads, aiding in wind dispersal of its seeds.
